Tolkien-related events that took place in 1944.

content.title: January
content.content:
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 53b.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 54.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 55.
? - Christopher Tolkien is sent to South Africa for pilot training in the Royal Air Force.[1]

content.title: February
content.content:
13 - John Tolkien is made an Exorcist and Acolyte in a ceremony at Stonyhust.
18 - Anthony Jackson, the Tale Bearer in the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, is born in Birmingham, England.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 55a.

content.title: May
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 65.
4 - While writing on The Lord of the Rings, J.R.R. Tolkien sees a new character arrive on the scene. He later comments: "(I am sure I did not invent him, I did not even want him, though I like him, but there he came walking into the woods of Ithilien): Faramir, brother of Boromir".
5 - John Rhys-Davies, who would play Gimli and voice Treebeard in The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 66.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 67.

content.title: October
content.content:
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 83.
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 84.
12 – J.R.R. Tolkien sends Leaf by Niggle to the Dublin Review, which hosts a short-story competition. It was published in the January 1945 issue.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 85.
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 86.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives a letter from 12 year old John Barrow from West town, Pa.. The boy has already read The Hobbit eleven times, and his use of the term "Gee Whiz" delights Tolkien.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 87.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 88.
? - Gene Hargrove, author and composer, is born.

? - Dutch translator Peter Cuijpers is born.
? - Sir Orfeo is published.
(Autumn) - Tolkien starts writing Book V of The Lord of the Rings.[2]
